profiles:
Summary 15+ years experience, results-driven web strategist with a passion for creating meaningful digital experiences that balance smart design with business objectives. Summary 15+ years experience, results-driven web strategist with a passion for creating meaningful digital experiences that balance smart design with business objectives. 15+ years experience, results-driven web strategist with a passion for creating meaningful digital experiences that balance smart design with business objectives. 15+ years experience, results-driven web strategist with a passion for creating meaningful digital experiences that balance smart design with business objectives. Experience Product Design and User Experience Lead Intel Corporation May 2013  – Present (2 years 4 months) Portland, Oregon Area -- Working across diverse products and teams in Intel's Software and Services Group. 
 
-- Create and design the UX vision for the projects in which I am involved. 
 
-- Lead the effort to help teams build and execute to this vision. 
 
 Senior User Experience Designer / Frontend Developer (consultant) iTVX (acquired by Rentrak) March 2013  –  May 2013  (3 months) Portland, Oregon Area Senior User Experience Designer (consultant) Concentric Cloud Solutions (part of XO Communications) October 2012  –  February 2013  (5 months) Senior User Experience Designer (consultant) Nike January 2012  –  September 2012  (9 months) -- Part of Nike’s Product Creation Solutions organization, responsible for delivering enterprise-class tools. 
 
-- Collaborate with business analysts, product owners, and engineering teams to ensure user needs and business process requirements are incorporated into system design solutions.  
 
-- Produced process flows, wireframes, and visual design mockups as needed to effectively conceptualize and communicate detailed interaction behaviors to end-users and stake holders. Senior User Experience Designer and Frontend Developer Sitka Technology Group May 2011  –  January 2012  (9 months) Portland, Oregon Area -- Lead user experience and user interface design for enterprise level custom web applications. 
 
-- Work with closely with management and engineers to create and execute the design and UX vision. 
 
-- Hands-on visual designer, providing design direction to external clients and internal development teams. 
 
-- Provide all UI design assets from wireframes and mockups to completed designs. 
 
-- Provide production ready HTML and CSS for engineering. 
 
-- Provide direction and best practices for integrating user experience concepts into an iterative, Agile environment. Senior Producer | Web Design | Web Dev | SEO Quinstreet, Inc February 2008  –  April 2011  (3 years 3 months) -- Develop short- and medium-term strategies for website development and growth based on traffic, search engine keyword analysis and business priorities. 
 
-- Focus on lead generation and email marketing. Manage an email list over 1 million users. 
 
-- Manage the editorial tone and direction, and content of the sites, coordinating with changing business priorities and audience.  
 
-- Work with a cross-functional team of developers, content editors, and designers to successfully execute those strategies.  
 
-- Coordinate with related teams, such as editorial team, social media, data services, creative services, and engineering.  
 
-- Identify high-growth and high-revenue opportunities, and taking the lead on executing them, measuring them and optimizing their performance on each online property. 
 
-- Seek marketing opportunities and improvements and interaction with the client account managers. 
 
-- Ensure growth of traffic, revenue, conversion rate and revenue per visitor. 
 
-- Daily reporting on the performance of each site and troubleshooting of problems. Web Manager / Designer The Vancouver Voice September 2006  –  August 2008  (2 years) Designed the online presence for the The Vancouver Voice, an alternative newspaper serving the Vancouver and Southwest Washington area. 
 
Lead design, frontend development, and implementation of content management system. Director of Web Development ReliableRemodeler.com, Inc. November 2006  –  February 2008  (1 year 4 months) Manage a small agile team of developers and content editors to maintain and grow ReliableRemodeler.com. 
 
-- Worked with management team on overall site strategy to grow site traffic while ensuring the best user experience for our customers. 
 
-- Ensure that business requirements are clearly defined and executed properly for all development projects. 
 
-- Responsible for guiding development of internal web applications. 
 
-- Drive creative direction and user interface design for all ReliableRemodeler.com sites and web applications. 
 
-- Responsible for email campaigns, landing page performance, and search engine optimization. Senior Strategist/Information Architect Opus Creative Group November 2005  –  September 2006  (11 months) Responsible for gathering requirements, wireframes, and documentation of application flows. Provide recommendations on site strategy and insight on usability. 
 
Frontend developer as needed on projects. Proficient with HTML, CSS, and standards-based development. 
 
Clients include Nike, Intel, Tektronix, Travel Oregon, Embassy Suites Waikiki, Waikiki Beach Walk, Provenance Hotels, Flowerbud.com Art Director/Frontend Developer/Information Architect ISITE Design, Inc. October 1998  –  August 2005  (6 years 11 months) All-around web designer and developer. Versatile team player who fulfilled multiple roles, depending on project requirements.

Summary I conduct foundational, strategic user research that informs product design, user experience roadmaps, and long-term planning efforts. I generate business impact at the portfolio level across BUs and teams within an organization. And I strive to deliver delightful products that directly (and indirectly) improve people's lives. 
 
I have earned an international patent for my innovative design work at IBM, I have designed and conducted tactical and strategic research studies at VMware, Intel, Google, Microsoft, and the University of Washington, and I have developed end-to-end user experiences for products that millions of people use every day. 
 
The results of my research have achieved recognition from leaders in the HCI and CSCW communities in the form of publications, awards, presentations, and service as a program committee member and journal editor. I have shared the results of my research through interviews with news and media outlets such as The New York Times, USA TODAY, The International Herald Tribune, Consumer Reports, and CNET. 
 
My 3-year plan is to continue building my reputation as a top HCI and CSCW researcher and UX practitioner by working for leading technology companies and building visibility across professional communities. 
 
Specialties: User experience research, user experience design, HCI, product management, collaborative work, information design, Sesame Street character voice impersonations Summary I conduct foundational, strategic user research that informs product design, user experience roadmaps, and long-term planning efforts.
